title: Effect of Calcium Influx through TRPV1

content.question: Read each question carefully. Write your response in the space provided for each part of each question. Answers must be written out in paragraph form. Outlines, bulleted lists, or diagrams alone are not acceptable and will not be scored. Increased expression and activity of the ligand-gated ion channel <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has been shown to block cell division and induce apoptosis in human cells. The structure of the <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein consists of several transmembrane domains that are embedded in the membrane as well as a carboxy-terminus and an amino-terminus that are located inside the cell (Figure 1). Figure 1. Structure of the <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein channel in the membrane <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is activated by several stimuli, including the binding of capsaicin, a chemical found in chili peppers. Capsaicin enters the cell by simple diffusion and then binds to one of the transmembrane domains of <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which opens the ion channel. The opening of the <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> channel allows <math alttext="C a with a plus two charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ca</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions to enter the cell, leading to the activation of the enzyme calcineurin. Calcineurin removes phosphate groups from the phosphorylated form of the transcription factor <math alttext="N F A T 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NFAT2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which is typically found in the cytoplasm. Once dephosphorylated, <math alttext="N F A T 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NFAT2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> moves into the nucleus, where it blocks the transcription of another protein, <math alttext="A T F 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATF3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="A T F 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATF3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, when active, prevents the cell cycle regulatory protein <math alttext="p G o G" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pGoG</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from inducing apoptosis and blocking cell division (Figure 2). Figure 2. Capsaicin-activated <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> signaling pathway in human cells (a) Describe the differences between the <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> groups of the amino acids located in the transmembrane domains and those located in the amino- or carboxy-terminus of <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Describe the specific location in the cell where <math alttext="T R P V 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TRPV1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein is synthesized.

(d) The drug cyclosporin <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is known to inhibit calcineurin. Support the researchers' claim based on the pathway shown in Figure 2.
